title: 7 Amazon Prime Day Christmas Tree Deals for Faux Fir Enthusiasts (2025)
description: Ho-ho-hot deals through July 11 on these pine tree impressions
author: Julia Harrison
excerpt: Christmas-in-July lover? You're in luck: Amazon is offering Prime Day Christmas tree deals for those who like to celebrate the holiday season all year long.
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.We all know them, and love them, if exasperatedly—the Christmas in July celebrators. Amazon is cleverly churning out Prime Day Christmas Tree Deals to delight this personality type, with Balsam Hill down 30% in some cases, and tabletop options starting at a mere $30. Fans of Love Is Blind will recall it was this very obsession that brought together a fan-favorite on the show—they loved Christmas. That’s how easy it is to find love in the Minneapolis dating pool, I guess—you just have to love Christmas.Featured in this articleA Festive Best-SellerNational Tree Company Faux Douglas Fir with StandJump to reviewFor Small SpacesBest Choice Products Pre-Lit Flocked Faux Pencil TreeJump to reviewBest on a BudgetBest Choice Products Faux Spruce Tree with BaseJump to reviewWhether you’re an enthusiast of the festive season, or just the sort of pragmatic person who plans their holiday decor strategy five months ahead, there’s a slew of seriously discounted options on artificial Christmas trees that won’t leave behind nests worth of needles. (And should they drop a couple branches here and there, we have a list of recommended vacuums for sucking those up.) The tree options are supplemented with decorative pinecones, multicolor LED lights, tinsel, and all kinds of Christmas decor must-haves we’ll let you peruse yourself. For now: let’s just get you a high-quality option at a low price.National Tree Company Faux Douglas Fir with StandContributor DaVonne Bacchus gave this best-selling douglas fir from National Tree Company an eight out of 10 in terms of easy setup, which is nothing to scoff at for a tree over seven feet tall. It carves out a decent section of Christmas space in your living room, so make sure you’ve got a corner squared off for festivities. Bacchus said it took about an hour to fluff it all the way out, and at 5’5,” a step ladder was necessary. The metal base keeps it as steady as can be, but might be a bit of an eye sore, so we’d recommend a tree skirt while you’re at it. Don’t worry, those are on sale, too.Best Choice Products Pre-Lit Flocked Faux Pencil TreeIf you’ve got a small corner in need of some holiday zhuzhing or your square footage eliminates the possibility of a proper Balsam, a pencil Christmas tree delivers on festivity without taking up too much space. This particular model comes frosted in a warm white, a pink, and a purple-forward option. Though a slim Christmas tree, keep in mind this comes in options up to 12 feet in case that little corner is also abnormally tall. The four-and-a-half foot option is great for a porch decoration, but contributor Kristi Kellogg found that the nine-foot took less than 15 minutes to assemble, and gave it a 10 in terms of easy setup.Yaheetech Pre-Lit Faux Tree with Foldable StandAt six feet tall and pre-lit, this tree from Yaheetech looks like it spent the better part of its days on the Nutcracker stage. The warm white string lights and frosted cover give it the exact sort of Winter Wonderland vibe we’re all after when the season (or July!) comes around. Brie Schwartz, the commerce director at Glamour, has had this tree for three years and speaks highly of it: “This tree, which I bought after reading some positive Amazon reviews three years ago, has been one of the simplest to assemble. (We’ve come a long way from the color-coded branches of my youth). There are only three parts: a base, a middle, and a top section. No instructions are needed.”Best Choice Products Faux Spruce Tree with BaseAt $64, this is one of the best Prime Day deals on artificial Christmas trees, but note: $64 gets you the basics. This tree comes unlit, with zero pomp and frills, so you’ll need to add holiday decor yourself. While commerce producer Lauren Arzbaecher gave it a three for its ability to describe itself, she maintained that it delivered on its functionality—here’s a six-foot impression of a blue spruce that, with a little fluff of its branch tips, yields a completely reliable Christmas tree.Best Choice Products Faux Pink Fir Tree with StandThis is a completely unique option that I love looking at and imagining what sort of home it might find itself in. Over seven feet tall, it will make a hell of an impact in your space, and three sections and a foldable base make for an easy setup and takedown.National Tree Company Pre-Lit Faux Mini Fir Tree with BaseIf you’re looking for a mini Christmas tree, and a suitable tabletop option, this pre-lit model from National Tree Company checks all the boxes. It’s discounted 35%, comes seated in darling holiday bags, with either a battery operated or plug-in option, depending on your outlet availability.National Tree Company Artificial Pre-Lit Kingswood Fir Christmas TreeThis slim Christmas tree can fit even in tight (tall) spaces. Not only that, but you can change the light settings from warm white to multicolor, and also set them to “dance” mode for a bit of extra holiday cheer. Nota bene: this also comes with a sturdy metal stand, so you’ll want to check for tree skirts here, too. Or tall presents.
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

We all know them, and love them, if exasperatedly—the Christmas in July celebrators. Amazon is cleverly churning out Prime Day Christmas Tree Deals to delight this personality type, with Balsam Hill down 30% in some cases, and tabletop options starting at a mere $30. Fans of Love Is Blind will recall it was this very obsession that brought together a fan-favorite on the show—they loved Christmas. That’s how easy it is to find love in the Minneapolis dating pool, I guess—you just have to love Christmas.

Featured in this article

Whether you’re an enthusiast of the festive season, or just the sort of pragmatic person who plans their holiday decor strategy five months ahead, there’s a slew of seriously discounted options on artificial Christmas trees that won’t leave behind nests worth of needles. (And should they drop a couple branches here and there, we have a list of recommended vacuums for sucking those up.) The tree options are supplemented with decorative pinecones, multicolor LED lights, tinsel, and all kinds of Christmas decor must-haves we’ll let you peruse yourself. For now: let’s just get you a high-quality option at a low price.

National Tree Company Faux Douglas Fir with Stand

Contributor DaVonne Bacchus gave this best-selling douglas fir from National Tree Company an eight out of 10 in terms of easy setup, which is nothing to scoff at for a tree over seven feet tall. It carves out a decent section of Christmas space in your living room, so make sure you’ve got a corner squared off for festivities. Bacchus said it took about an hour to fluff it all the way out, and at 5’5,” a step ladder was necessary. The metal base keeps it as steady as can be, but might be a bit of an eye sore, so we’d recommend a tree skirt while you’re at it. Don’t worry, those are on sale, too.

Best Choice Products Pre-Lit Flocked Faux Pencil Tree

If you’ve got a small corner in need of some holiday zhuzhing or your square footage eliminates the possibility of a proper Balsam, a pencil Christmas tree delivers on festivity without taking up too much space. This particular model comes frosted in a warm white, a pink, and a purple-forward option. Though a slim Christmas tree, keep in mind this comes in options up to 12 feet in case that little corner is also abnormally tall. The four-and-a-half foot option is great for a porch decoration, but contributor Kristi Kellogg found that the nine-foot took less than 15 minutes to assemble, and gave it a 10 in terms of easy setup.

Yaheetech Pre-Lit Faux Tree with Foldable Stand

At six feet tall and pre-lit, this tree from Yaheetech looks like it spent the better part of its days on the Nutcracker stage. The warm white string lights and frosted cover give it the exact sort of Winter Wonderland vibe we’re all after when the season (or July!) comes around. Brie Schwartz, the commerce director at Glamour, has had this tree for three years and speaks highly of it: “This tree, which I bought after reading some positive Amazon reviews three years ago, has been one of the simplest to assemble. (We’ve come a long way from the color-coded branches of my youth). There are only three parts: a base, a middle, and a top section. No instructions are needed.”

Best Choice Products Faux Spruce Tree with Base

At $64, this is one of the best Prime Day deals on artificial Christmas trees, but note: $64 gets you the basics. This tree comes unlit, with zero pomp and frills, so you’ll need to add holiday decor yourself. While commerce producer Lauren Arzbaecher gave it a three for its ability to describe itself, she maintained that it delivered on its functionality—here’s a six-foot impression of a blue spruce that, with a little fluff of its branch tips, yields a completely reliable Christmas tree.

Best Choice Products Faux Pink Fir Tree with Stand

This is a completely unique option that I love looking at and imagining what sort of home it might find itself in. Over seven feet tall, it will make a hell of an impact in your space, and three sections and a foldable base make for an easy setup and takedown.

National Tree Company Pre-Lit Faux Mini Fir Tree with Base

If you’re looking for a mini Christmas tree, and a suitable tabletop option, this pre-lit model from National Tree Company checks all the boxes. It’s discounted 35%, comes seated in darling holiday bags, with either a battery operated or plug-in option, depending on your outlet availability.

National Tree Company Artificial Pre-Lit Kingswood Fir Christmas Tree

This slim Christmas tree can fit even in tight (tall) spaces. Not only that, but you can change the light settings from warm white to multicolor, and also set them to “dance” mode for a bit of extra holiday cheer. Nota bene: this also comes with a sturdy metal stand, so you’ll want to check for tree skirts here, too. Or tall presents.
